topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53acbfb06368722accaa0100#post_53acbfb06368722accaa0100
I'm starting to realize what seems to be the main cause of why we're as a whole almost across the board wrong about everything is we spend too much time essentially overthinking things and trying to find some intrinsic moral lesson in everything.

To use a analogy let's say you give five dollars to a homeless person; chances are you're probably going to spend five minutes thinking on it and whether or not he's going to spend it on booze or actually spend it on food and whether or not you should have given him money, but in reality all you did was you gave money cause you felt like it.

Essentially people need to stop writing 2000 pages essays on the morality of giving money and realize that giving money is simple in that "I felt like giving money cause I wanted to help them" instead of some grand journey into the world about vanquishing your inner greed or something like that.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
